projectArray.title: Pokedex Project
projectArray.content: during this Project, the class was encouraged to create a pokemon trainer showcase (Pokedex) website that displayed information using AJAX to retrieve said data. We focused on client side technologies and learned about Object Oriented programming, JavaScript, APIs, AJAX, grid systems, SASS, UI/UX and deployment via Github Pages.

projectArray.title: Pokemon Gym
projectArray.content: The main goal was to work together via GitHub  implementing Agile software. It was imperative to understand each member's code before implementing your own. This skill is essential to successfully work within a software engineering team.

projectArray.title: Bakery Website
projectArray.content: The main goal was to work on Ubuntu using Ruby and Sinatra along with other gems. During this project, we built a class object per item sold. These objects represent digital versions of cookies/cakes/muffins which were stored as data that we utilized when displaying information about our items. Also learned to make a CSV file.

projectArray.title: Food blog
projectArray.content: EggsOnTheWall is a food inspired blog I created using Ruby and Sinatra. In this website, you'll be able to create/delete an account as well as to create posts. Upon successful completion of this project, I was able to obtain an understanding of Sinatra, ActiveRecord, Cookies, log-in and log-out functions and deployment to Heroku.

projectArray.title: Project Numero 5
projectArray.content: We focused on creating a one page website for a fictional paper company that would be exciting for the end user. We utilized semantic HTML, proper element targeting in CSS, behavioral Javascript, and animations.
